metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42528 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit 2021.07 (and earlier) is affected by a Null pointer dereferencevulnerability when parsing a specially crafted file. An unauthenticatedattacker could leverage this vulnerability to achieve an applicationdenial-of-service in the context of the current user. Exploitation of thisissue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a maliciousfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exempi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
